item.description:
A Night of Comedy: "Martinis and Merriment"
WHEN: Saturday, Nov. 12 at 7:30 p.m.
Trip's Coordinator (TC) is Rose

EVENT: Get ready to laugh the night away, and enjoy a martini or two, when the Jewish Community Center in Newton hosts "Martinis and Merriment: Old (and Young) Jews Telling Jokes", featuring Sam Hoffman, the man behind the web site "Old Jews Telling Jokes", along with stand-up comedian Jon Fisch and Rabbi Moshe Waldoks, author of "The Big Book of Jewish Humor". Following the show, mix and mingle with your Mosaic friends over martinis and munchies, plus meet the performers at a post show book signing.

RSVP: The RSVP deadline is Nov. 12, or until the show is sold out.
MEET: At 7 p.m. in the lobby of the Leventhal-Sidman Jewish Community Center, located at 333
Nahanton St., Newton.
COST: Tickets can be purchased for $20 (rather than the full price of $26), on the JCC web site using a promo code that the Trip's Leader will send to those who sign up for the event. There is a $2 convenience fee for booking on the web, but not if the tickets are purchased at the box office. The JCC has assigned tables 14 and 15 to Mosaic, though others will be able to purchase tickets at those tables as well.

Additional Fees: There is a $5 fee for meetup participants and guests which can be credited toward a full Mosaic membership of $25.  For more information and the promo code please email the TC at: rolshevskyj@gmail.com.
item.how_to_find_us: rsvp for the details and plan to meet in the lobby

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: A Night of Comedy: "Martinis and Merriment"
